00020 
00021 #include "calvin_files/Extractor/src/CmdLine.h"
00022 #include "calvin_files/converters/chp/comparer/CHPComparer.h"
00023 #include "calvin_files/utils/src/FileUtils.h"
00024 //
00025 #include <cstring>
00026 #include <iostream>
00027 #include <string>
00028 //
00029 
00030 using namespace affymetrix_calvin_utilities;
00031 using namespace affymetrix_comparer;
00032 
00033 /*! The input file1 tag. */
00034 #define INPUT_FILE1_ARG "-i1"
00035 
00036 /*! The input file2 tag. */
00037 #define INPUT_FILE2_ARG "-i2"
00038 
00039 /*! The help tag. */
00040 #define HELP_ARG "-h"
00041 
00042 /*
00043  * Show a help message.
00044  */
00045 void ShowHelp()
00046 {
00047         cout
00048                 << "Command line arguments:" << endl
00049                 << "\t" << INPUT_FILE1_ARG << " <the full path of the reference CHP file>" << endl
00050                 << "\t" << INPUT_FILE2_ARG << " <the full path of the comparison CHP file>" << endl << endl
00051                 << "Possible return codes are:" << endl
00052                 << "\t" << " 0 [success]" << endl
00053                 << "\t" << "-1 [commandline argument errors]" << endl
00054                 << "\t" << "-2 [files do not compare]" << endl << endl;
00055 }
00056 
00057 /*! The options for the comparer. */
00058 typedef struct _ComparerOptions
00059 {
00060         /*! The first file. */
00061         string file1;
00062 
00063         /*! The second file. */
00064         string file2;
00065 
00066 } ComparerOptions;
00067 
00068 /*
00069  * Get the file name and library path from the command line arguments.
00070  * Show the help if required.
00071  */
00072 bool GetArguments(int argc, char **argv, ComparerOptions &options)
00073 {
00074         CCmdLine cmdLine;
00075 
00076         // parse argc,argv 
00077         // no switches were given on the command line, abort
00078         if (cmdLine.SplitLine(argc, argv) < 1)
00079         {
00080                 ShowHelp();
00081                 return false;
00082         }
00083 
00084         // test for the 'help' case
00085         if (cmdLine.HasSwitch(HELP_ARG))
00086         {
00087                 ShowHelp();
00088                 return false;
00089         }
00090 
00091         // get the required argument
00092         try
00093         {
00094                 options.file1 = cmdLine.GetArgument(INPUT_FILE1_ARG, 0);
00095                 options.file2 = cmdLine.GetArgument(INPUT_FILE2_ARG, 0);
00096         }
00097         catch (...)
00098         {
00099                 // one of the required arguments was missing, abort
00100                 ShowHelp();
00101                 return false;
00102         }
00103         return true;
00104 }
00105 
00106 /*
00107  * Compare the two input files
00108  */
00109 int main(int argc, char* argv[])
00110 {
00111         // Get the input file name.
00112         ComparerOptions options;
00113         if (GetArguments(argc, argv, options) == false)
00114                 return -1;
00115 
00116         // Compare the files
00117         CHPComparer comp;
00118         int ret = 0;
00119         if (comp.CompareFiles(options.file1.c_str(), options.file2.c_str()) == true)
00120         {
00121                 cout << "The files are identical" << endl;
00122         }
00123         else
00124         {
00125                 cout << comp.Differences() << endl;
00126                 ret = -2;
00127         }
00128 
00129         return ret;
00130 }
